abstract.p: Jerry Eliason letter on Daniel Menaker's September 3 article lauds Emmylou Harris's new sound (S)

block.p: Country music, which has long coddled its elderly, now has in Emmylou Harris a better example of how to grow old gracefully (Daniel Menaker, Sept. 3). Compared with the thick paint, toupees and wobbly voices that have populated the Opry, Harris retains not only a dignified (and attractive) physical presence but also continues to experiment with her sound. She may not post big sales numbers, but she will remain an artistic force long after Shania's navel and Garth's hat are distant memories.
Without tagging her with that overused epithet ''survivor,'' I just hope that Emmylou is around to witness and be a part of a long overdue country renaissance.
